https://github.com/Templarian/MaterialDesign //Help Dialog Browser Open the help dialog to get informations concerning:

• important functions
• handling
• search The lists:
In every list there is one entry as default. This is needed to create a database. You can delete this entry after you saved new items to your list. Every list has a context menu, which you can reach by long pressing an item. The readLater and history lists can be cleared with one click.

• Bookmark: as always - save your favorite websites for a faster access.
• readLater: here you can save websites if you want to read them anytime later, if they are not important enough to be a bookmark.
• History: well, your browser history.
• passStorage: here you can save (encrypted) login data from websites. If you want to delete entered login data on exit, you must enable \"clear cookies on exit\" in the settings.

Toolbar (bottom):
• Swipe (only text field): to the left to open your bookmarks and to the right to open your readLater list. Swipe to top to close the app.
• Search (left icon): you can enter a search term (see below) or a url. By pressing \"enter\" or the magnifier icon, the website will load.
• History (right icon): opens a list of the last visited websites.

Menu:
• Save website: you can save the website to your bookmark, readLater or passStorage list or save a screenshot of the whole website.
• Share website: you can share the screenshot of a website, share the link as text or copy the link to the clipboard.
• Search on site: search for text on any website.
• Open passStorage: open your login data list.
• Open download directory: opens the download directory to show, share, rename or delete files.
• Settings (start screen): In the settings you can configure the behavior of the app, some privacy and security settings. At the app start these settings will always be loaded.
• Settings (browser): Here you can overwrite the default settings for a short time. These settings will get lost at the next app start. By clicking the red cross you can also add websites to a whitelist for javascript. They will be marked with a \"green check icon\". Javascript will then always be allowed for these websites (even after restarting the app).

Search:
You can set your preferred search engine and the language for Wikipedia in the settings. You can search direct on different sites by clicking the list symbol right of the magnifier icon.
